title: Alison Wonderland Welcomes Second Son: ‘Baby Bro Is Very Chill’
summary: The producer is also releasing her Ghost World album on Dec. 5.
body: Alison Wonderland has delivered her latest production: a baby boy. On Monday (Nov. 10), the electronic producer announced that she’s given birth to her second son, writing “Welcome to earth, Ash West. Baby bro is very chill & loves listening to anything electronic at 140bpm (almost a week old & kid already has taste). s/o to the drs, nurses and the NICU for being awesome.” The Australia-born, Los Angeles-based producer also shared several photos of herself and her new baby. See the post here . Wonderland and her husband, the filmmaker Ti West, also have another son, Max, who was born in the summer of 2023. The post’s comments section is naturally a celebratory space, with fellow electronic artists including Anna Lunoe, TroyBoi, Slander, DJ Dave, Diplo, Mary Droppinz and many more expressing their congrats. Baby Ash is the first of two very big projects Wonderland is dropping in this time period, as the producer’s fourth studio album, Ghost World , is coming Dec. 5. (While it was originally scheduled for an October release, production delay issues pushed the project to December.) “I am in a completely different part of my life now,” the artist …

title: Summer Walker Reveals Chris Brown, GloRilla, 21 Savage, Latto, Sexyy Red & More Features on ‘Finally Over It’ Album
summary: Pour Minds podcast hosts Drea Nicole and Lex P acted as caterers at Walker's wedding gossiping about the A-list guests on her third album, out Friday.
body: Summer Walker revealed the star-studded list of collaborators on her forthcoming third studio album Finally Over It on Monday (Nov. 10). She partnered with Spotify on the exclusive two-part announcement, that includes a behind-the-scenes clip from Walker’s “wedding” (as teased in her album artwork ) and a reception seating chart graphic of the featured artists, songwriters and producers who worked on Finally Over It , both of which can be found below. Drea Nicole and Lex P, the hosts of the Pour Minds podcast, act as caterers of Walker’s wedding while gossiping about her A-list guests. “Did you see 21 Savage with that plate of beans?… You know he British, chile,” Lex told Drea. Walker has previously collaborated with the British-born, Atlanta-bred rapper four times: a remix of Jhené Aiko’s “Triggered” in 2019, 2020’s “Secret,” Usher’s 2023 hit “Good Good,” and 2024’s “prove it” from 21 Savage’s third studio album American Dream . Drea wondered if Anderson .Paak would give them his wig vendor because “hair was laid,” she complimented. She also didn&#82…

title: Rock & Roll Hall of Fame Wins Lawsuit Over Van Halen Photo in Museum Exhibit
summary: Rejecting a copyright case filed by a litigious photographer, a judge found the Rock Hall made "fair use" of the image.
body: A federal judge rejected a lawsuit claiming the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame broke the law by using a copyrighted photo of Eddie Van Halen in a museum exhibit. Dismissing a case filed by rock photographer Neil Zlozower, Judge Christopher A. Boyko said the Rock Hall made legal “fair use” of the image — a black-and-white photo of late-’70s Van Halen in the recording studio — by using it in an exhibit about famous guitars. Related Rock & Roll Hall of Fame Aims to Axe Copyright Lawsuit Over Van Halen Guitar Photo Billboard's Live Music Summit Honors Khalid with VENU's Disruptor Award Female Agents Have Come a Long Way, But There's Still Progress to Be Made: 'We Have to Continue to Fight for Each Other' Even though the Hall made a “nearly exact” copy of a portion of the photo, the judge says it did so for a very different purpose from the original: “The court concludes that defendant’s use of plaintiff’s copyrighted photographs is fair use,” the judge wrote. Zlozower filed his case last year , claiming the Hall needed a license to show the photo in the exhibit. He claimed the Cleveland institution didn’t even include credit or a source for the image wh…

title: Kelly Clarkson Recalls Fiery Response to Manager Who Told Her to Get a Boob Job: ‘Why Don’t You Get a Di– Job?’
summary: The star added that she's just fine with her "itty bitty ti--ies," thank you very much.
body: Kelly Clarkson is ready for the industry to break away from toxic beauty standards — or, at the very least, for people to stop thinking it’s acceptable to tell women what to do with their bodies. While onstage for one of her Studio Session shows at Caesars Palace in Las Vegas over the weekend, the hitmaker took a moment to make sure her deep V-neck top was covering up everything it needed to, which reminded her of an unpleasant interaction with someone in the music business. “I had some di– manager one time tell me to get a boob job,” she recalled, the shock of the experience returning to her face as if it had just happened in that moment. Related Kelly Clarkson Reveals Her Top Three Albums of All-Time: ‘I Hope You Like Them, If You Don’t, You’re Dumb’ Kelly Clarkson Is ‘Finding the Light’ in Talk Show Season Premiere: ‘The World Can Be Very Heavy’ Drew Barrymore Wins in an Upset Over Kelly Clarkson at 2025 Daytime Emmys “I was like, ‘Why don’t you get a di– job?'” Clarkson continued. “I’m fine with my itty bitty ti–ies, get out of here.&#822…

title: From Beauty to Tech & Everything in Between – the 15 Best Gifts From Oprah’s 2025 ‘Favorite Things’ List
summary: We narrowed it down to our top 15 picks from Oprah's holiday gift guide that will surely bring a smile to anyone this holiday season.
body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. You get a gift! You get a gift! Everybody gets a gift! Oprah Winfrey has just released her highly-anticipated 2025 “Favorite Things” list , detailing her top choices in every category from food, home and beauty to food and “wellness” — creating the ultimate gift guide for those who aren’t yet sure what to get their loved ones this holiday season. Oprah’s list is extensive, and the countless options could be overwhelming for someone who doesn’t know where to start. We at  Billboard have your back by narrowing it down to our top 15 picks from Oprah’s holiday gift guide, situating our picks into comprehensive categories for you to shop with ease. We’ve included some of our faves from brands like Ninja, Apple, Saie, Dyson and so much more. Shop our picks below. title: Billboard Partners With Starlite for First Billboard No. 1s Event in Spain
summary: The multi-artist show, scheduled for Dec. 15, is part of Starlite Madrid.
body: Billboard has partnered with Starlite, the Spanish company that produces and hosts the annual Starlite Festivals in Marbella and Madrid, to produce its first Billboard No. 1s event outside of the United States, and the first to be devoted to Latin Music. Billboard No. 1s Spain — or Billboard Números Uno España — will take place Dec. 15 at IFEMA in Madrid, as part of the week-long programming of Starlite Madrid . The evening will feature performances by artists who have entered the top 10 of the Billboard Hits of the World Spain Songs chart, along with special honors. Related Billboard Latin Music Awards 2025 Winners: Complete List Billboard's Live Music Summit Honors Khalid with VENU's Disruptor Award Female Agents Have Come a Long Way, But There's Still Progress to Be Made: 'We Have to Continue to Fight for Each Other' Although Billboard has hosted other Billboard No. 1s, this marks the first time the event will feature multiple live performances in a concert setting. View this post on Instagram “Partnering with Billboard , the Bible of the music industry, is an honor for us,” said Sandra García-Sanjuán , founder and CEO of Starlite. “It’s an honor t…

title: Adin Ross Calls Kendrick Lamar’s Music ‘Horrible,’ Says Drake Saved His Career With Feud: ‘Y’all Know I’m Not Capping!’
summary: Ross went on a rant against Lamar during his latest livestream.
body: During his most recent livestream, Adin Ross criticized Kendrick Lamar ‘s music as “ass” and said Drake not only has way better music, but shows more support for his fellow rappers. On Sunday, the streamer revisited the 2024 beef between The Boy and K-Dot, saying that Drake singlehandedly revived Lamar’s career due to their vitriolic feud. “Listen to this… 2021 plus, Drake’s killing him,” said Ross, as seen in the clip here. “If it’s 2010 plus, Drake’s killing him. Kendrick’s catalog is horrible, and y’all know I’m not capping. It’s f—ing a–! Nobody listened to Mr. Morale . GNX — Drake saved his miraculous career because he f—ing… ‘Wow, the beef.’ Who gives a sh–?” Ross also criticized Lamar for his lack of features while hyping up Drizzy’s forthcoming album Iceman . “Kendrick is a–. He does nothing for any other rappers,” Ross continued. “Doesn’t do verses. He does nothing! He does nothing for rap. Drake, you need a verse: ‘Here you go, guys!'” The praise should come as no surprise considering how often Ross shows love to Drake and has the 6 God on his livestream. “I f— with him, bro,” Ross said during …

title: Billboard’s Music Industry Events Calendar
summary: A complete rundown of the most important events across the music business.
body: As part of our continuing efforts to serve the music industry and its creators, Billboard Pro now features a music industry events calendar for readers. The calendar will act as music’s most complete summary major national and international industry events, from conferences to festivals to networking mixers and more. Just as Billboard is music’s must-read source for news, charts and analysis, now it also is the go-to for business happenings. title: Michael Jackson Makes History as First Artist to Score Hot 100 Top 10 Hits in Six Different Decades
summary: The late King of Pop’s “Thriller” gives him top 10 placements in every decade from the 1970s through the 2020s.
body: Michael Jackson ’s “Thriller” strikes like a beast, rising from No. 32 to No. 10 on the Billboard Hot 100 dated Nov. 15, granting the late King of Pop a new chart longevity record. With the song, which hit No. 4 on the Hot 100 in 1984, Jackson, who died in 2009, becomes the first artist ever to rank in the top 10 in six distinct decades (the 1970s, ‘80s, ‘90s, 2000s, ‘10s and now ‘20s). Related Taylor Swift’s ‘The Fate of Ophelia’ Leads Hot 100 for Fifth Week, Michael Jackson’s ‘Thriller’ Returns to Top 10 These Acts Have Scored Top 10 Hits on the Billboard Hot 100 Across Four (or More) Decades Michael Jackson Biopic Trailer Breaks Record With 116 Million Views Jackson surpasses Andy Williams, who died in 2012 and whose history includes placements in the top 10 in five decades (‘50s, ’60s, ’70s, ‘10s and ’20s, extended since 2018 thanks to “It’s the Most Wonderful Time of the Year”). Jackson first reached the Hot 100’s top 10 as a soloist in November 1971 with his debut on his own, “Got To Be There.” Jackson boasts 30 top 10s, including 13 No. 1s. Until this week, Jackson, who died in 2009, last ranked in the top 10 as featured on Drake’s “Don’t Matter to Me” in 201…

title: The Best Meme Reactions to Rosalía’s Orchestral Masterpiece ‘Berghain’
summary: Here's how the Internet is reacting to Rosalía's new music.
body: Rosalía has surprised fans with the release of her new studio album LUX , an ambitious 18-track set performed in 13 languages and backed by the London Symphony Orchestra. She gave fans the first taste in late October with the single “Berghain” featuring Björk and Yves Tumor, surprising with her lyrical performance in an operatic soprano voice and ease to toggle from the English to German to Spanish languages. The orchestral masterpiece—which peaked at No. 16 on Hot Rock Alternative Songs; No. 13 on Hot Alternative Songs; No. 22 on Billboard Global 200; and No. 14 on Billboard Global Excl. U.S. charts (all dated Nov. 15)—is about a woman tormented by a toxic relationship. “This album has a completely different sound than any of the projects that I’ve done before,” the Spanish singer-songwriter said in her recent Billboard cover story . “It was a challenge for me to do a more orchestral project and learn how to use an orchestra, understand all the instruments, all the possibilities, and learn and study from amazing composers in history and say, ‘OK, that’s what’s been done. What can I do that feels personal and honest for me?’ And also the challenge of having that inspiration in cla…

title: 'He fixes what needs fixing' - why Raducanu turned to Nadal's ex-coach
summary: Emma Raducanu recently appointed another full-time coach in Spaniard Francisco Roig - BBC Sport speaks to those who know him best.

title: 'He has made young players dream' - the making of Liverpool icon Salah
summary: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

title: Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in fight in US
summary: The story of Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in a sanctioned fight in the United States.

title: The Vasa galleon: The ship that sank in the Baltic Sea
summary: Divers and historians make new discoveries about a remarkably well-preserved 17th-century galleon
